author: cnbc.com
title: GEICO Board Elevates O'Malley Gallaro
text:
WASHINGTON--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- The GEICO board of directors recently named Melissa Gallaro vice president of GEICO; Gallaro will also continue to serve as vice president of GEICO Insurance Agency (GIA), which manages partner companies for personal lines insurance products on behalf of GEICO. The board also named Denise O’Malley, of Buffalo, N.Y., an assistant vice president of GEICO.
This press release features multimedia. View the full release here: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20180228005867/en/
Denise O'Malley (Photo: Business Wire)
O’Malley has responsibility for GEICO Insurance Agency sales and service operations that offer homeowners, renters, boat and other personal lines insurance coverage.
She began her GEICO career in 2005 as a military sales associate at the company’s Virginia Beach, Va., regional office. After working in several other capacities, she was named a sales manager in the motorcycle division in 2010. O’Malley moved to Indianapolis in 2013 to help open GEICO’s office where she made major contributions to help grow that operation.
O’Malley, who has a business administration degree from Indiana Institute of Technology, made the transition to the GEICO Insurance Agency in 2016, eventually moving to Buffalo to oversee the service division there.
Gallaro joined GEICO in 2002 as a sales counselor at the company’s Woodbury, N.Y., regional office, where she later was named the planning manager. She relocated to GEICO’s Fredericksburg, Va., regional office in 2009 and went on to become the sales and service director for the GEICO Insurance Agency.
She was elected an officer in December 2014, managing GIA centers in Buffalo, Fredericksburg and Virginia Beach and leading GIA partner relations. With her recent promotion, she now oversees GIA’s digital platform.
Gallaro, who is based at the Fredericksburg’s office, earned a bachelor’s degree in business administration from Mary Washington University and an MBA from Long Island University.
About GEICO
GEICO (Government Employees Insurance Company) is a member of the Berkshire Hathaway family of companies and is the second-largest private passenger auto insurance company in the United States. GEICO, which was founded in 1936, provides millions of auto insurance Quote: s to U.S. drivers annually. The company is pleased to serve more than 16 million private passenger customers, insuring more than 27 million vehicles (auto & cycle).
Using GEICO’s online service center , policyholders can purchase policies, make policy changes, report claims and print insurance ID cards. Policyholders can also connect to GEICO through GEICO Mobile , reach a representative over the phone or visit a GEICO local agent .
GEICO also provides insurance Quote: s on motorcycles, all-terrain vehicles (ATVs), boats, travel trailers and motorhomes (RVs). Coverage for life, homes and apartments is written by non-affiliated insurance companies and is secured through the GEICO Insurance Agency, Inc. Commercial auto insurance and personal umbrella protection are also available.
For more information, go to www.geico.com .
